channel.title: Sydney gamers take to the streets over lack of R18+ rating
channel.description:
[url='https://uk.gamespot.com/news/6245096.html']Source[/url] [quote] Australia has earned itself a negative reputation when it comes to banning video games, and 2009 did little to help the country shake it off. Not only were several high-profile games banned, but the much lauded R18+ classification discussion paper was pushed back time and time again, before its eventual release in December.
With the discussion paper having done the rounds of the gaming groups, Luke Lawrie from R18+ Games Australia is organising an information day in Sydney's CBD at the Queen Victoria Building, on the corner of George and Druitt Streets, on the 9th of January. The aim of the day is to educate Australians outside of the gaming community about the lack of an R18+ classification, with Lawrie telling GameSpot AU that they will be specifically targeting older people who are less likely to know about video games.
The event has no sponsors backing it and is entirely done out of love, with Lawrie personally putting over A$300 towards printing information sheets and forms. So far he expects around 10 people to help, but said if more people turn up, he'll be looking at expanding to other areas of the city to try and spread the word. [/quote] This seems somewhat important because from what I can tell, a lot of people here are from Australia.

Im dangerous and violently insane because of videogames and i come from superior racial stock. so i can see why they might be wary about letting a bunch of inbred hicks and criminals who live on a giant island made of magic rocks and uranium near them tbh

Go fuck your self and then jump off the Westgate bridge.

On topic: yes i havent even purchased l4d2 cause i know it will just be some cut up coppy which just ruins my enjoyment

I didn’t even know this was on, and if I did I probably still would’ve stayed home. I doubt protesting will change anything, knowing our backwards, old fashioned, stubborn, pig-headed politicians.

Couldnt have said it better my self.

well Australians are naturally lazy, we don’t really try to change much, we just go with the flow. On the other hand if we ran out of our homes in riot, burning cars and attacking police, im sure the 18+ rating would come soon.

Lrn2michaelatkinson

The government has been trying to put a rating in place, but the South Australian attourney-general, Michael Atkinson, Has the power to veto these changes, and he has thus far.
